item.title: Do Kink Encounters Have to Count as Cheating?
item.description: My desires won’t go away, but my partner’s not interested. Is there an ethical way to explore them?

item.title: Should You Dry Someone Else’s Abandoned Laundry?
item.description: A ruling on a dispute over wet clothing.

item.title: Why Are So Many Pop Stars Trying to Win Over Country Fans? Ask Shaboozey.
item.description: For years, the country music star struggled to stake a claim to the version of himself that now seems inevitable.

item.title: John Green Doesn’t Want You to Lose the Magic of Your Teenage Self
item.description: The writer and YouTube star on trying to get back to the experiences that make us feel alive.

item.title: Do We Have to Spend the Holidays With My Parents?
item.description: Time with the extended family isn’t particularly restful or enjoyable for us.

item.title: I’m a Professor. A.I. Has Changed My Classroom, but Not for the Worse.
item.description: My students’ easy access to chatbots forced me to make humanities instruction even more human.

item.title: The Social-Media Platform That Makes You Tell the Truth
item.description: Strava logs all your fitness achievements — and then some.

item.title: A Dish of One’s Own
item.description: At big family-style holiday meals, a single-serving entree is a welcome interlude.

item.title: The Athlete Trolling His Way Through Jiu-Jitsu’s Culture Wars
item.description: Brazilian jiu-jitsu has been increasingly embraced by right-wing influencers. Craig Jones is an unlikely counterforce.

item.title: Can I Use My Parents’ Address to Get Our Kids Into a Better School?
item.description: I feel guilty about the lie we’d have to keep up, but we would be much happier.

item.title: A Rich Chickpea Stew That Tastes Like an Oasis
item.description: A writer in Afghanistan finds momentary peace in saland-e nakhod.

item.title: My Father Had an Affair While My Mother Was Dying. Should I Tell My Siblings?
item.description: I get that peeking at his emails was an invasion of privacy, but it is not something I can unsee.

item.title: Why Does A.I. Write Like … That?
item.description: If only they were robotic! Instead, chatbots have developed a distinctive — and grating — voice.

item.title: The Dark Secrets of the Writer Behind ‘Train Dreams’
item.description: An adaptation of Denis Johnson’s novella arrives at the same time as a new biography, unlocking one of his best-loved and least-understood books.
